Class Brawl

  • java.lang.Object
    • Brawl
  • public class Brawl
extends Object
    The brawl itself, containing many players who take part in repeated rounds. The brawl takes in the participating players as an array, and can be run multiple times. When run, the brawl returns the name of the winning player.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      (package private) boolean desc  
      (package private) Player[] players  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Brawl​(Player[] p)
      Constructor, with an array of players and printing turned off.
      Brawl​(Player[] p, boolean d)
      Full Constructor, with an array of players and whether the brawl is printed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Player lastPlayer()
      Returns the first living player in the Brawl's array.
      int livingPlayers()
      Returns the number of currently living players in the brawl.
      void resetPlayers()
      Resets each player in the brawl to default.
      String run()
      Runs the brawl and returns the name of the winner.

        clone, equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        Returns the number of currently living players in the brawl.

      • lastPlayer

        public Player lastPlayer()
        Returns the first living player in the Brawl's array. Meant to be called when only 1 player is left.
